paper_abstract: This work examines the contour tracking problem of redundant robot on a path with singularity. Using an optimal quadratic programming method is to solve the singularity problem and the computing load of motion planning is reduced by a novel hybrid motion planning method. To achieve contour tracking with output feedback, an integral sliding mode control with a high-gain observer is employed to eliminate the chattering due to discontinuous switching control of the sliding-mode control and maintain robustness of the ideal sliding mode.
paper_title: Contour Tracking of a Redundant Robot Using Integral Variable Structure Control with Output Feedback
